headline: SAYS REDS INSULT THE UNITED STATES; Secretary Wilson in Letter to Martens's Counsel Arraigns the Soviet Military Dictatorship. CONTRASTS OUR SYSTEM Idea That This Country Could Be Bought Denounced as Brutal Materialist Conception.
leadPara: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30.--A scathing arraignment of the attitude and shortcomings of the Soviet military dictatorship in Russia is contained in a letter written by Secretary of Labor Wilson and made public today addressed to Charles Recht of New York City, counsel ...

headline: CLOTHING FACTORY BARS ALIEN WORKERS; William Bandler, Head of Manufacturers' Association, to Employ Only Americans.
leadPara: William Bandler, President of the Clothing Manufacturers' Association of New York, last night discussed conditions under which manufacturers would resume negotiations with the Amalgamated Clothing Makers of America.
abstract: Bandler says mfrs will employ only Amer citizens, aliens to be barred

headline: SECOND OPERATION TO RELIEVE CARUSO; Six Physicians Remove Pus From Pleural Cavity--Tenor Cheerful Under Knife. HIS CONDITION IS SERIOUS But Secretary at Midnight Says He Is Much Improved--Denies Alarming Rumors.
leadPara: Enrico Caruso was still seriously ill with pleurisy, but much improved, last midnight, according to a statement to THE NEW YROK TIMES by Bruno Zirato, his secretary, who discussed the case just after one of the six attending physicians had examined into the tenor's condition.
abstract: 2 operations for pleurisy

headline: RALLY TO LEYGUES IN WAR ON REDS; French Deputies Vote Confidence, 451 to 54, When Communist Leader Challenges.PLAN STERN REPRESSION Any Attempt at Uprising to Be Put Down With Every Means at Government's Command.RADICAL SPLIT COMPLETERight and Centre Declare Themselves the Socialist Party as Communists Form Band Apart. Cachin's Speech Disappointing. Socialists Quit Communists.
leadPara: An overwhelming vote of confidence in the Government in connection with the Tours Socialist Congress was given by the Chamber of Deputies this evening.
abstract: Vote of confidence by Chamber of Deputies following challenge to Govt by Socialist Congress at Tours
